messages.message:
Hey team - A blast from the past here I'm sure - But NatWest are upgrading from 24.01 to 24.07 and their Ops team are complaining that the colour has changed on their classification labels and they are concerned that the change will impact the pace at which they are able to review and won't sign off UAT pre-upgrade. Although a short term pain, they want to know if we can change back to the colours before (I said this is very unlikely). They also want reassurance this won't happen every time we upgrade them. Although this isn't relevant as we're moving them to AI Hub soon - I think it is useful feedback to share, as even something as simple as a colour change can impact the Ops teams use and efficiency of the platform.

So:
1. Why did the colours change post upgrade?
2. Are we able to change it back?
3. Do we have the same colour coding in Ai Hub classes in human review - and do these remiain the same with upgrades?

We select class colors from a set of colors in AI Hub and ib classic human review and assign a color to a classification based on its index. As a result, the color assigned to a classification can be random from the set of colors.
I don't think we will change it back, however it should be aligned with how AIHub does it
@Udit - does his therefore mean when we move this solution to AI Hub the colours will remain the same? @Hannah is that something you can check with the solution we have built?
This is what we have for the current solution, only dealing with the two classes for now though
Let me check what is being done in 24.07 before confirming but they should remain the same most likely.
yah, they use the same colors as AI Hub!
They’re not from the photos … the right hand side is 24.07 and they are not the same colours as what Hannah is sharing in AiHub
well the colors are the same, but the classes as seen already have different names and are in a different order so the color they will be assigned is different.
